Description: Yellow painted shabti of a Wʿb-priest of Amun, probably Djedkhons, with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a summarily modelled face with black eyes and crossed hands in relief holding two black relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket; the lower leg section has broken away.
Condition: incomplete - lower leg section missing, cracked at waist level
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
